args: Melsa, could you look at the skies for me?\nI'd like to know if this clear weather is\ngoing to continue.
You wish me to read the weather?\nI'd be happy to.
Hmm. The clouds are shaped like that...\nAnd the wind is blowing this way...
Yes, it will be clear all day.
Ah, good. Then we can hang this laundry\nout to dry without worry.
Each new person who comes to the\nHalidom adds to our ever-growing pile\nof dirty linens.
It must be a lot of work for you to\nworry about that day after day, Cleo.
Well, I find it much more fulfilling than\nthe long years I spent alone.
I see. ...Er, if I may be so bold:\nhow old are you?
Oh, somewhere around three or four\nhundred years, give or take.
Goodness! You don't look even remotely\nthat old.
If you don't mind me asking, how have you\nmaintained your youthful appearance\nafter all this time?
Oh, I'm happy to tell you.
However, it will probably be quite a long\nstory. Perhaps I can regale you while\nwe take care of the washing.
Ah, yes, I'll dry this laundry here, then.
Let's see, wherever should I begin...?
Well, if you're not sure, perhaps I could\nstart by asking a question I've had on\nmy mind for some time.
Well, now I'M curious.\nWhatever could it be?
Well, I was wondering why you came here.
Yes. I know of very few sylvans who have\never left their village.
I mean, I can see it for a go-getter like\nLuca who acts before he thinks, but you\nseem much more thoughtful.
Well, if that is your question, then my\nanswer is quite simple...
I was linked to my master by fate, and in\nthe course of following him, happened\nupon this place.
He was precious to me, so it's only natural\nthat I would have accompanied him\nanywhere in the world.
So it's your master who was the go-getter!
Correct. Back then, it was one breathless\nadventure after another.
But one day, my master departed on a\njourney and never returned.
With his parting words, he left the castle\nin my care.
And so it is my duty to obey his command,\nno matter how much time might pass.
It's amazing that you'd go so far for\nsomeone important to you, Cleo.
I thought you and I might be alike,\nbut we're actually quite different.
Oh? And here I had been thinking that we\nWERE alike, as you said.
Was your reason for coming here not your\ndevotion to {player_name}?
Not quite. I came here because the prince\nsaved me and my village.
It was to repay the debt I owe him,\nnothing more.
In that case, I'd like to ask you another\nquestion of my own.
When the debt is settled, will you return\nto your village?
Why not think about it now?
Well then, once I repay my debt...
I think I'll want to stay wherever\n{player_name} is.

I suspected as much. We're alike,
you and I, so we have a way of
knowing these things about one
another.
I don't even know the reason WHY I want\nto remain with {player_name}!
Heh. That's how these things are.
I was also unsure of the reason why I\nwanted to follow my master at first.
...But I've spoken of myself for far too long.\nLet us leave things there.
For now, if I could say one thing to you...

I think the two of youyou and
{player_name}are more alike
than you might think. Both unfailingly kind,
and both aiming for similar dreams.
I'm not entirely sure I know what\nyou mean.
Well, perhaps it's not something you'll\nimmediately understand.
So, for starters, perhaps you should work\non trying to understand those things.
My dreams...and his. Very well.\nI will do so.
I hope you'll keep taking care of me here\nfor a while longer so I can accomplish\nthat goal.
